Just wondering if someone where has been able to succesfully
initialize log4j within the junit task in an ant script.  There is a
log4j.properties file in the same directory that I'm running the
junit task, the log4j.properties file is in the classpath as well. 
This works for me when running junit via IntelliJ so I know that
log4j.properties file is okay.  I've even tried passing in the jvm
arg -Dlog4j.configuration parameter in the junit task and that
doesn't seem to work either.  I must be doing something obviously
wrong but I can't seem to figure it out.   Thanks in advance. 



Brian Doyle

I don't know about ignorance, and I don't care about apathy, but I simply will not put up with intolerance!  - Unknown
